revision.text: ==English== {{wikipedia}} ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|en|Earwood}} ===Etymology=== Two main origins: * Habitational surname from a place in [[Cheshire]], from {{der|en|ang|earn||eagle}} + {{m|ang|wudu||wood}}. * Anglicized form of the {{der|en|cy|-}} personal name {{m|cy|Iorwerth}}, composed by the elements {{m|cy|ior||lord}} + {{m|cy|berth||handsome}}. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun|s}} # {{surname|en}}. ====Statistics==== * According to the 2010 United States Census, ''Yarwood'' is the 44109<sup>th</sup> most common surname in the United States, belonging to 488 individuals. ''Yarwood'' is most common among White (88.93%) individuals. ===Further reading=== * {{R:en:DAFN}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=adoorwy|doorway}} [[Category:English surnames from Old English]] [[Category:English surnames from Welsh]]
